Was sind Datenspende-Studien?
Definition ğŸ’¡: Datenspende-Studien sind eine nutzerzentrierte Methode zur Sammlung von Daten:


Nutzende haben das Recht, Daten, die Plattformen Ã¼ber sie sammeln, anzufragen und herunterladen.
Sie kÃ¶nnen ihre Datenpakete (DDPs) via Datenspende-Tools (DDTs), oft im Rahmen von Umfragen, der Wissenschaft zur VerfÃ¼gung stellen.
Forschende nutzen CSS-Methoden zur Filterung, Anonymisierung und Analyse dieser Daten.

section: What is the goal of this workshop?
text:
What is the goal of this workshop?


âœ… Understanding digital data traces as a type of data
âœ… Understanding data donation as a method of data access

Availabillity

Be careful: These â€œadvantagesâ€ are often claimed, but not empirically proven.
Digital traces are neither necessarily less biased, nor cheaper, or larger (we will discuss this in Session 4ï¸âƒ£ & 5ï¸âƒ£).

title: Data Donation Studies: COMPTEXT Workshop
text:
(Dis-)advantages of digital trace data


âœ… More fine-grained measures due to timestamps
âœ… Partly measurement of new variables (e.g., algorithmic inference)
âŒ Bias due to errors in representation and measurement
âŒ Implementation can be expensive
âŒ More data does not mean better data!
